comment._content: Hmm, are you sure this was taken in 'some time in 2008'? :)

comment.author: 71087757@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Buoyant, and we'd love to have this added to the group! So great to see a Buoy pic in The Commons!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: A Naval gunboat. I don't know if it is more properly called HMS Neptune. There's a wonderful description in the SMH of 13/4/1887 of a day's exercise on the 'Neptune', including the firing of that bow cannon, a 64 pounder MLR [sic - RML = Rifled Muzzle Loading] slide-gun. Really brings this otherwise ho-hum picture to life. trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13660801?searchTerm=hms%... Milsons Point in the background.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: "The weather was wet, and the air was raw and cold..." - a great enhancement of the photo beachcomberaustralia. I dare say you wouldn't be able to creep up on the enemy with that smokestack!
